===Aku Aku===

{{nihongo|'''Aku Aku'''|ã¢ã¯ã»ã¢ã¯|Aku Aku}} is the guardian of the Wumpa Islands and the father figure of Crash and his friends. He is voiced by [[Mel Winkler]] in his English speaking appearances up to ''Crash Twinsanity'', and by [[Greg Eagles]] from ''Crash of the Titans'' onwards. He is voiced by [[Kenichi Ogata]] in the Japanese versions of his speaking appearances up to ''Crash Twinsanity''.
{{nihongo|'''Aku Aku'''|ã¢ã¯ã»ã¢ã¯|Aku Aku}} is the guardian of the Wumpa Islands and the father figure of Crash and his friends. He is voiced by [[Kenichi Ogata]] in the Japanese versions of his speaking appearances up to ''Crash Twinsanity''.
Line 27: Line 26:
===Crunch Bandicoot===
===Crunch Bandicoot===
â
[[Image:MindOverMutantCrunch.PNG|200px|right|thumb|Crunch Bandicoot in ''Crash: Mind over Mutant'']]
 
{{nihongo|'''Crunch Bandicoot'''|ã¯ã©ã³ãã»ãã³ãã£ã¯ã¼|Kuranchi BandikÅ«}} is a genetically altered bandicoot who was originally created by Doctor Cortex to destroy Crash Bandicoot. After his defeat to Crash, Crunch had a [[change of heart]] and now tries to be a positive role model to children. He is Crash and Coco's friend and protects them from harm. He is voiced by [[Kevin Michael Richardson]] in ''Crash Bandicoot: The Wrath of Cortex'' and ''Crash Nitro Kart'', and by [[Chris Williams (actor)|Chris Williams]] (in the style of [[Mr. T]]) from ''Crash Tag Team Racing'' onwards. In the Japanese version of the series, he is voiced by [[YÅ«ji Kishi]] in ''Crash Bandicoot: The Wrath of Cortex'' and ''Crash Nitro Kart'', by [[Masafumi Kimura]] in ''Crash Tag Team Racing'', and by [[Shinya Fukumatsu]] in ''Crash Boom Bang!''.
{{nihongo|'''Crunch Bandicoot'''|ã¯ã©ã³ãã»ãã³ãã£ã¯ã¼|Kuranchi BandikÅ«}} is a genetically altered bandicoot who was originally created by Doctor Cortex to destroy Crash Bandicoot. After his defeat to Crash, Crunch had a [[change of heart]] and now tries to be a positive role model to children. He is Crash and Coco's friend and protects them from harm. He is voiced by [[Kevin Michael Richardson]] in ''Crash Bandicoot: The Wrath of Cortex'' and ''Crash Nitro Kart'', and by [[Chris Williams (actor)|Chris Williams]] (in the style of [[Mr. T]]) from ''Crash Tag Team Racing'' onwards. In the Japanese version of the series, he is voiced by [[YÅ«ji Kishi]] in ''Crash Bandicoot: The Wrath of Cortex'' and ''Crash Nitro Kart'', by [[Masafumi Kimura]] in ''Crash Tag Team Racing'', and by [[Shinya Fukumatsu]] in ''Crash Boom Bang!''.
Line 40: Line 38:
===Doctor N. Gin===
===Doctor N. Gin===
â
[[Image:MindOverGin.JPG|right|thumb|Doctor N. Gin in ''Crash: Mind over Mutant'']]
 
{{nihongo|'''Doctor N. Gin'''|ãã¯ã¿ã¼ã»ã¨ãã»ã¸ã³|DokutÄ Enu Jin|spelled '''N-Gin''' in the Radical Entertainment games}} was the right-hand man of Doctor Neo Cortex, replacing Doctor Nitrus Brio after ''Crash Bandicoot''.<ref name="Crash2Sketches">{{cite web |publisher=Naughty Dog |title=[ Crash Gallery - Character Sketches - ''Crash 2'' <nowiki>]</nowiki> |url=http://www.naughtydog.com/crash/crash/c2-character.htm |accessdate=2008-08-10}}</ref> He has since been replaced by the person he succeeded, Nitrus Brio. He is voiced by [[Brendan O'Brien (voice actor)| Brendan O'Brien]] in the Naughty Dog games, by [[Corey Burton]] in ''Crash Bandicoot: The Wrath of Cortex'', by [[Quinton Flynn]] in ''Crash Nitro Kart'' and ''Crash Twinsanity'', and by [[Nolan North]] (in the style of [[Peter Lorre]]) in the Radical Entertainment games. In the Japanese version of the series, he is voiced by [[Kazuhiro Nakata]] in the games up to ''Crash Twinsanity'', and by [[Mitsuru Ogata]] in ''Crash Tag Team Racing''.
{{nihongo|'''Doctor N. Gin'''|ãã¯ã¿ã¼ã»ã¨ãã»ã¸ã³|DokutÄ Enu Jin|spelled '''N-Gin''' in the Radical Entertainment games}} was the right-hand man of Doctor Neo Cortex, replacing Doctor Nitrus Brio after ''Crash Bandicoot''.<ref name="Crash2Sketches">{{cite web |publisher=Naughty Dog |title=[ Crash Gallery - Character Sketches - ''Crash 2'' <nowiki>]</nowiki> |url=http://www.naughtydog.com/crash/crash/c2-character.htm |accessdate=2008-08-10}}</ref> He has since been replaced by the person he succeeded, Nitrus Brio. He is voiced by [[Brendan O'Brien (voice actor)| Brendan O'Brien]] in the Naughty Dog games, by [[Corey Burton]] in ''Crash Bandicoot: The Wrath of Cortex'', by [[Quinton Flynn]] in ''Crash Nitro Kart'' and ''Crash Twinsanity'', and by [[Nolan North]] (in the style of [[Peter Lorre]]) in the Radical Entertainment games. In the Japanese version of the series, he is voiced by [[Kazuhiro Nakata]] in the games up to ''Crash Twinsanity'', and by [[Mitsuru Ogata]] in ''Crash Tag Team Racing''.
Line 51: Line 48:
===Tiny Tiger===
===Tiny Tiger===
â
[[Image:TitansTinyTiger.PNG|right|thumb|Tiny [[Tiger]] in ''Crash of the Titans'']]
 
{{nihongo|'''Tiny Tiger'''|ã¿ã¤ãã¼ã»ã¿ã¤ã¬ã¼|TainÄ« TaigÄ|erroneously named '''Taz Tiger''' in the pause screen of the North American version of ''Crash Bandicoot 2: Cortex Strikes Back''}} is a minion of Doctor Neo Cortex. He is voiced by [[Brendan O'Brien (voice actor)| Brendan O'Brien]] in the PlayStation games, by [[John DiMaggio]] in ''Crash Nitro Kart'', by Chris Williams (in the style of [[Mike Tyson]]) from ''Crash of the Titans'' onwards, and by Nolan North in the [[Nintendo DS]] version of ''Crash of the Titans''. In the Japanese version of the series, he is voiced by [[Fumihiko Tachiki]] in the PlayStation games, and by Masafumi Kimura in ''Crash Nitro Kart''.

In the Japanese version of the series, he is voiced by [[Fumihiko Tachiki]] in the PlayStation games, and by Masafumi Kimura in ''Crash Nitro Kart''.
Line 62: Line 58:
===Uka Uka===
===Uka Uka===
â
[[Image:MindOverUkaUka.JPG|right|thumb|Uka Uka in ''Crash: Mind over Mutant'']]
 
{{nihongo|'''Uka Uka'''|ã¦ã«ã»ã¦ã«|Uka Uka}} is the evil younger twin brother of Aku Aku. Uka Uka was created by Naughty Dog as a presence that was able to cause even Neo Cortex to cower in fear.<ref name="Crash3Sketches"/> He was voiced by Clancy Brown from 1998 to 2003, by [[Alex Fernandez (actor)|Alex Fernandez]] in ''Crash Twinsanity'', and by [[John DiMaggio]] from ''Crash of the Titans'' onwards. He is voiced by [[RyÅ«zaburÅ Åtomo]] in the Japanese versions of his appearances up to ''Crash Twinsanity''.

Uka Uka was created by Naughty Dog as a presence that was able to cause even Neo Cortex to cower in fear.<ref name="Crash3Sketches"/> He was voiced by Clancy Brown from 1998 to 2003, by [[Alex Fernandez (actor)|Alex Fernandez]] in ''Crash Twinsanity'', and by [[John DiMaggio]] from ''Crash of the Titans'' onwards. Line 73: Line 68:
===Dingodile===
===Dingodile===
â
[[Image:Dingodile titans.jpg|200px|right|thumb|Dingodile in the Nintendo DS version of ''Crash of the Titans'']]
 
{{nihongo|'''Dingodile'''|ãã£ã³ã´ãã¤ã«|Dingodairu}} is a minion of Doctor Neo Cortex. Dingodile was created when Naughty Dog member [[Joe Labbe]] asked for a character that was a cross between a [[dingo]] and a [[crocodile]].<ref name="Crash3Sketches"/> Dingodile is voiced by [[William Hootkins]] in ''Crash Bandicoot 3: Warped'', by [[Dwight Schultz]] in ''Crash Nitro Kart'' and ''Crash Twinsanity'', and by Nolan North from ''Crash of the Titans'' onwards. In the Japanese version of the series, he is voiced by [[Keisuke Ishida]] in the PlayStation games, and by [[Hajime Iijima]] in ''Crash Nitro Kart'' and ''Crash Twinsanity''.
{{nihongo|'''Dingodile'''|ãã£ã³ã´ãã¤ã«|Dingodairu}} is a minion of Doctor Neo Cortex. Dingodile was created when Naughty Dog member [[Joe Labbe]] asked for a character that was a cross between a [[dingo]] and a [[crocodile]].<ref name="Crash3Sketches"/> Dingodile is voiced by [[William Hootkins]] in ''Crash Bandicoot 3: Warped'', by [[Dwight Schultz]] in ''Crash Nitro Kart'' and ''Crash Twinsanity'', and by Nolan North from ''Crash of the Titans'' onwards. In the Japanese version of the series, he is voiced by [[Keisuke Ishida]] in the PlayStation games, and by [[Hajime Iijima]] in ''Crash Nitro Kart'' and ''Crash Twinsanity''.
Line 84: Line 78:
===Doctor Nitrus Brio===
===Doctor Nitrus Brio===
â
[[Image:MindOverMutantBrio.PNG|200px|right|thumb|Doctor Nitrus Brio in ''Crash: Mind over Mutant'']]
 
{{nihongo|'''Doctor Nitrus Brio'''|ãã¯ã¿ã¼ã»ããã©ã¹ã»ããªãª|DokutÄ Nitorasu Burio}} is a scientist who formerly worked under Doctor Neo Cortex. Brio was created by Naughty Dog as a foil for Doctor Cortex: "meek to Cortex's strength, logical to Cortex's emotional, successful (his inventions work) to Cortex's failure."<ref name="Crash1Sketches"/> Brio is voiced by [[Brendan O'Brien (voice actor)| Brendan O'Brien]] in the English versions of ''Crash Bandicoot'' and ''Crash Bandicoot 2: Cortex Strikes Back'', and by [[Maurice LaMarche]] in ''Crash: Mind over Mutant''. He is voiced by [[Mitsuru Ogata]] in the Japanese version of the series up to ''Crash Bash''.
{{nihongo|'''Doctor Nitrus Brio'''|ãã¯ã¿ã¼ã»ããã©ã¹ã»ããªãª|DokutÄ Nitorasu Burio}} is a scientist who formerly worked under Doctor Neo Cortex. Brio was created by Naughty Dog as a foil for Doctor Cortex: "meek to Cortex's strength, logical to Cortex's emotional, successful (his inventions work) to Cortex's failure."<ref name="Crash1Sketches"/> Brio is voiced by [[Brendan O'Brien (voice actor)| Brendan O'Brien]] in the English versions of ''Crash Bandicoot'' and ''Crash Bandicoot 2: Cortex Strikes Back'', and by [[Maurice LaMarche]] in ''Crash: Mind over Mutant''. He is voiced by [[Mitsuru Ogata]] in the Japanese version of the series up to ''Crash Bash''.
